text:
Is amazing that given the queue there is only 15 reviews. But honestly nostalgic point were scored more than actual taste. Got the basic lemon chicken rice for $3.50.

Pro
Chicken. Crispy, juicy and tasty.

Standard chill but being on the slightly sweeter side

Meh
While $3.50 seems cheap but not alot of chicken to be had. I will probably add a serving of fried chicken for $1.

Soup is weird. Fried shallot in soup.

Not much lemon sauce given.

Cons
The rice was soggy and sticky. Taste is there but too soggy.

This place only sells chicken cutlets with various gravy or grilled chicken chop rice.

I had the grilled chicken chop rice at $4. The rice is not too fragrant and a little dry. Chicken chop is average. Soup is a little blend too. Portions are decent.

Prices very affordable here, starting at $4.

Chicken cutlet seemed to be their speciality and I might consider going for that next time.

A very hearty plate of chicken rice. Price is right on point at $3bucks a plate and adding $1 for the chicken wing if one so wishes for more chicken. There was a short queue on a weekday lunch however service was efficient and brisk. Chicken was crispy and tasty.. i did feel however that the rice could be improved to be tastier.
Good value meal...just $4. Pork Cutlet Rice
This stall has been here since the 90s when I saw still schooling at Presbyterian High School. Very reasonably priced at $3 for the Lemon Chicken Rice and the hash brown is at an extra $0.70.
